paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant p.Asp219Val, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here, we describe and characterize a novel mutation, p.Asp219Val in the hERG channel, identified in an 11 year old male with syncope and prolonged QT interval.

functional_data.summary: The p.Asp219Val hERG channel produced K+ current that activated with modest changes in voltage dependence, was slower to inactivate, recovered from inactivation more readily, and demonstrated a significantly accelerated deactivation rate compared to the slow deactivation of WT channels.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is located in a region of the channel predicted to be unstructured and flexible.
key_quotes: The intermediate nature of the biophysical perturbation is consistent with the degree of severity in the clinical phenotype.
The findings of this study demonstrate a previously unknown role of the proximal N-terminus in deactivation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
